verses.verse: (For the choir director; on Muth-labben. A Psalm of David.) I will give <S%H3034><s%> thanks <S%H3034><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> with all <S%H3605><s%> my heart; <S%H3820><s%> I will tell <S%H5608><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> Thy wonders. <S%H6381><s%>
I will be glad <S%H8055><s%> and exult <S%H5970><s%> in Thee; I will sing <S%H2167><s%> praise <S%H2167><s%> to Thy name, <S%H8034><s%> O Most <S%H9411><s%> High. <S%H9411><s%>
When my enemies <S%H340><s%> turn <S%H7725><s%> back, <S%H268><s%> They stumble <S%H3782><s%> and perish before <S%H6><s%> <S%H4480><s%> Thee.
For Thou hast maintained <S%H6213><s%> my just <S%H4941><s%> cause; <S%H1779><s%> Thou dost sit <S%H3427><s%> on the throne <S%H3678><s%> judging <S%H8199><s%> righteously. <S%H6664><s%>

Thou hast rebuked <S%H1605><s%> the nations; <S%H1471><s%> Thou hast destroyed the wicked; <S%H6><s%> Thou hast blotted <S%H7563><s%> out their name <S%H4229><s%> forever <S%H8034><s%> and ever. <S%H5769><s%>

The enemy <S%H340><s%> has come <S%H8552><s%> to an end <S%H8552><s%> in perpetual <S%H5331><s%> ruins, <S%H2723><s%> And Thou hast uprooted <S%H5428><s%> the cities; <S%H5892><s%> The very <S%H1992><s%> memory <S%H2143><s%> of them has perished.
But the Lord <S%H3068><s%> abides <S%H3427><s%> forever; <S%H5769><s%> He has established <S%H3559><s%> His throne <S%H3678><s%> for judgment, <S%H4941><s%>
And He will judge <S%H8199><s%> the world <S%H8398><s%> in righteousness; <S%H6664><s%> He will execute <S%H1777><s%> judgment <S%H1777><s%> for the peoples <S%H3816><s%> with equity. <S%H4339><s%>
The Lord <S%H3068><s%> also will be a stronghold <S%H4869><s%> for the oppressed, <S%H1790><s%> A stronghold <S%H4869><s%> in times <S%H6256><s%> of trouble, <S%H6869><s%>

And those who know <S%H3045><s%> Thy name <S%H8034><s%> will put <S%H982><s%> their trust <S%H982><s%> in Thee; For Thou, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> hast not forsaken <S%H5800><s%> those who seek <S%H1875><s%> Thee.
Sing <S%H2167><s%> praises <S%H2167><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> who dwells <S%H3427><s%> in Zion; <S%H6726><s%> Declare <S%H5046><s%> among the peoples <S%H5971><s%> His deeds. <S%H5949><s%>
For He who requires <S%H1875><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%> remembers <S%H2142><s%> them; He does not forget <S%H7911><s%> the cry <S%H6818><s%> of the afflicted. <S%H6035><s%>

Be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to me, O Lord; <S%H3068><s%> Behold <S%H7200><s%> my affliction <S%H6040><s%> from those who hate <S%H8130><s%> me, Thou who dost lift <S%H7311><s%> me up from the gates <S%H8179><s%> of death; <S%H4194><s%>

That I may tell <S%H5608><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> Thy praises, <S%H8416><s%> That in the gates <S%H8179><s%> of the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Zion <S%H6726><s%> I may rejoice <S%H1523><s%> in Thy salvation. <S%H3444><s%>

The nations <S%H1471><s%> have sunk <S%H2883><s%> down <S%H2883><s%> in the pit <S%H7845><s%> which they have made; <S%H6213><s%> In the net <S%H7568><s%> which <S%H2098><s%> they hid, <S%H2934><s%> their own foot <S%H7272><s%> has been caught. <S%H3920><s%>

The Lord <S%H3068><s%> has made <S%H3045><s%> Himself known; <S%H3045><s%> He has executed <S%H6213><s%> judgment. <S%H4941><s%> In the work <S%H6467><s%> of his own hands <S%H3709><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is snared. <S%H5367><s%> Higgaion <S%H1902><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
The wicked <S%H7563><s%> will return <S%H7725><s%> to Sheol, <S%H7585><s%> [Even] all <S%H3605><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> who <S%H7913><s%> forget <S%H7913><s%> God. <S%H430><s%>
For the needy <S%H34><s%> will not always <S%H5331><s%> be forgotten, <S%H7911><s%> Nor the hope <S%H8615><s%> of the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> perish forever. <S%H6><s%>
Arise, <S%H6965><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> do not let man <S%H582><s%> prevail; <S%H5810><s%> Let the nations <S%H1471><s%> be judged <S%H8199><s%> before <S%H5921><s%> <S%H6440><s%> Thee.
Put <S%H7896><s%> them in fear, <S%H9252><s%> O Lord; <S%H3068><s%> Let the nations <S%H1471><s%> know <S%H3045><s%> that they are but men. <S%H582><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
